levels.descriptor: The writing lacks a central idea or purpose. Ideas are extremely limited or unclear, with attempts at development that are minimal or nonexistent.
Main ideas and purpose are somewhat unclear or development is attempted but minimal. Details are irrelevant, repetitive, or insufficient.
The reader can understand the main ideas, although they may be overly broad or simplistic. Supporting detail is often limited, insubstantial, or occasionally off-topic.
The writing is clear and focused. The reader can easily understand the main ideas. Support is present, though may be overly general or limited in places.
The writing is clear, focused, and interesting. Main ideas stand out and are developed by supporting details suitable to audience and purpose.
The writing is exceptionally clear, focused, and interesting. It holds the reader's attention throughout with strong support and rich details.
The essay is awkward and fragmented. Ideas are not self-contained and there is no clear structure.
Shows little or no evidence of organization. The writing lacks coherent structure.
The essay shows some organization. Ideas may not be fully self-contained. Form may not match the expected format.
The essay shows satisfactory organization. Contains a basic introduction, body, and conclusion.
The essay shows good organization. There is a flow of ideas, though they may not be completely self-contained.
The essay is well-organized. There is a clear flow of ideas with each idea self-contained. Has appropriate form for the task.
The writing shows extremely limited vocabulary or words are misused so meaning is obscured. Words do not fit the text and seem imprecise or inadequate.
Language is monotonous and/or misused, detracting from meaning and impact. Words are flat, colorless, or imprecise with repetitive patterns.
Language lacks precision and variety, or may be inappropriate in places. Writing uses familiar but generic words that rarely capture reader interest.
Words effectively convey the intended message. Writer employs functional words appropriate to audience and purpose, though not particularly energizing.
Words convey the intended message in an interesting, precise, and natural way. Writer employs a broad range of carefully chosen words.
Words convey the intended message in an exceptionally interesting, precise, and natural way. Rich, broad vocabulary with words carefully placed for impact.
The writing is difficult to follow or read aloud. Sentences are incomplete, rambling, or irregular with confusing word order.
The writing tends to be choppy or rambling. Awkward constructions force rereading. Sentence patterns are monotonous.
The writing tends to be mechanical rather than fluid. Some passages invite reading while others are awkward. Some variety in structure exists.
The writing flows, though connections between phrases may be less than fluid. Sentence patterns are somewhat varied, contributing to ease in reading.
The writing has an easy flow and rhythm. Sentences are carefully crafted with strong and varied structure that makes reading enjoyable.
The writing has an effective flow and rhythm. Sentences show a high degree of craftsmanship with consistently strong and varied structure.
Numerous errors in usage, spelling, capitalization, and punctuation repeatedly distract the reader. The severity and frequency of errors make the text difficult to read.
The writing demonstrates little control of standard conventions. Frequent, significant errors impede readability.
The writing demonstrates limited control of standard conventions. Errors begin to impede readability with frequent spelling or grammar mistakes.
The writing demonstrates control of standard conventions. Significant errors do not occur frequently. Minor errors do not impede readability.
The writing demonstrates strong control of standard conventions. Errors are few and minor. Conventions support readability.
The writing demonstrates exceptionally strong control of standard conventions and uses them effectively to enhance communication.
